                                                                            –3–                                          M22/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

Subject Details: Biology SL Paper 2 Markscheme

Candidates are required to answer all questions in Section A and one out of two questions in Section B. Maximum total = 50 marks.

1.    Each row in the “Question” column relates to the smallest subpart of the question.

2.    The maximum mark for each question subpart is indicated in the “Total” column.

3.    Each marking point in the “Answers” column is shown by means of a semicolon (;) at the end of the marking point.

4.    A question subpart may have more marking points than the total allows. This will be indicated by “max” written after the mark in the “Total” column.
      The related rubric, if necessary, will be outlined in the “Notes” column.

5.    An alternative word is indicated in the “Answers” column by a slash (/). Either word can be accepted.

6.    An alternative answer is indicated in the “Answers” column by “OR”. Either answer can be accepted.

7.    An alternative markscheme is indicated in the “Answers” column under heading ALTERNATIVE 1 etc. Either alternative can be accepted.

8.    Words inside brackets ( ) in the “Answers” column are not necessary to gain the mark.

9.    Words that are underlined are essential for the mark.

10.   The order of marking points does not have to be as in the “Answers” column, unless stated otherwise in the “Notes” column.
                                                                           –4–                                          M22/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

                                                                        Section B
Extended response questions - quality of construction

        Extended response questions for SLP2 carry a mark total of [16]. Of these marks, [15] are awarded for content and [1] for the quality of
         the answer.

        [1] for quality is to be awarded when:
             the candidate’s answers are clear enough to be understood without re-reading.
             the candidate has answered the question succinctly with little or no repetition or irrelevant material.
                                                                             –5–                                    M22/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

                                                                          Section A
     Question                                                Answers                                                     Notes                      Total
1.     a    i    body temperature increases with ambient temperature / positive correlation;               Since direct can be either –/+,
                                                                                                           no credit for direct correlation          1
                                                                                                           alone
1.     a    ii   humans maintain/regulate a constant body temperature at different ambient
                                                                                                                                                     1
                 temperatures/maintained by homeostasis;
1.     b    i    As ambient temperature increases, the sloth spends more time with limbs
                      spread
                 OR
                                                                                                                                                     1
                 as ambient temperature increases the sloth spends less time curled in a ball
                 OR
                 as ambient temperature rises, the posture changes from 1 to 6;
1.     b    ii   a. less surface area is exposed when curled up
                 OR
                 more surface area is exposed when all limbs spread;
                                                                                                                                                   2 max
                 b. curled position prevents heat loss/provides warmth
                 OR
                 stretched out position allows more heat loss/body cooled;

1.     c         as body mass increases daily energy use increases
                 OR                                                                                                                                  1
                 positive correlation / positive logarithmic relationship / increasing by factor of 10;
1.     d         the daily energy use of the sloth is low (for its body mass compared to other mammals);
                                                                                                                                                     1
                                                                                                           OWTTE
1.     e         a. (X may represent the sloth) because the sloth/S and X have a similar body mass;
                 b. sloth does not use much energy because its locomotion is slow;
                                                                                                                                                     2
                 c. insufficient information is provided to identify X;
                 d. another mammal could occupy X;

1.     f         May;                                                                                                                                1
                                                                                                                                              (continued…)

(Question 1 continued)

     Question                                             Answers6                                                           Notes                 Total
1.     g         a. food intake rises as daily temperature increases / positive correlation;
                                                                                                                                                    2
                 b. the lowest food intake corresponds to the lowest temperature;
1.     h         a. the sloth will be more active at higher temperatures as it takes in more food for energy;   Reason required
                                                                                                                                                    1
                 b. as temperature rises, the sloth uncurls to dissipate/lose heat;

1.     i         a. mammals have mammary glands;                                                                Characteristic must be exclusive
                 b. produce milk for their offspring;                                                           to mammals
                                                                                                                If more than one answer, use the   1 max
                 c. bodies covered in hair/fur;                                                                 first one given




2.     a         20;                                                                                                                                 1
2.     b         a. increase in temperature/heat;
                 b. change of pH;
                                                                                                                                                   1 max
                 c. salt;
                 d. heavy metals;

2.     c         a. changes the shape of the (active site) of the enzyme;
                 b. substrate would be unable to attach to the enzyme/active site;                                                                   2
                 c. slows the enzyme activity / prevents reaction/catalysis from proceeding;

     Question                                               Answers                                                      Notes               Total
3.     a        0.87; (accept values between 0.8 and 0.9)                                                                                     1
3.     b        short-term reading could show global temperatures falling while the trend is rising
                OR                                                                                                                            1
                fluctuations from year to year may not show long-term trend;
3.     c        a. short wave radiation from sun passes through atmosphere / is not absorbed by CO2;         Do not accept “reflected” for
                b. infrared/long wave (radiation) / heat emitted from/released from (surface of) Earth;      mpb
                c. CO2 in the atmosphere absorbs infrared/long wave (radiation)/heat / cannot pass through                                   3 max
                the greenhouse gases;
                d. this results in warm/increased temperatures on Earth/global warming;


4.     a        0.5/50 %;                                                                                                                     1
4.     b        a. hemophilia is X-linked/sex-linked/carried on the X chromosome;
                b. females have two X chromosomes
                   OR
                   males only have one X chromosome;
                c. hemophilia is caused by a recessive allele;
                                                                                                                                             3 max
                d. (trait) must be on both alleles to be expressed
                   OR
                   females would require the allele on both X chromosomes to have the disease
                   OR
                   females can be carriers when allele is only on one chromosome;
                                                                             –8–                                      M22/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

     Question                                                 Answers                                                         Notes              Total
5.     a        0 mV; (accept answers in the range of – 10 mV to +10 mV) (Units required)

5.     b        sodium channels (start to) open                                                                   Reject pumping of ions
                OR
                depolarization/axon begins to depolarize                                                                                          1
                OR
                action potential occurs;
5.     c        Na+/sodium ions diffuse into the axon (in the first part/half of t);                              Do not accept the name
                K /potassium ions diffuse out of the axon (in the second half/part of t)
                 +                                                                                                of the element without
                                                                                                                                                  2
                                                                                                                  indication that it is an ion

5.     d        a. impulses pass to another neuron at a synapse/across synaptic gap/cleft;
                b. (depolarization causes) Ca2+/calcium ions to diffuse into the (presynaptic) neuron/axon;
                c. depolarization (of presynaptic neuron) causes release of a neurotransmitter
                OR
                                                                                                                                                 3 max
                neurotransmitters diffuse across the synapse;
                d. (neurotransmitters) bind to receptors on postsynaptic neuron/membrane;
                e. (if the threshold potential is reached) an action potential occurs/sodium gates open (in the
                postsynaptic neuron);

                                                                            Section B

           Clarity of communication: [1]
           The candidate’s answers are clear enough to be understood without re-reading. The candidate has answered the question succinctly
           with little or no repetition or irrelevant material.


     Question                                                        Answers                                                    Notes          Total
6.     a           a. unspecialized/undifferentiated stem cells can divide / differentiate along different pathways;
                   b. (stem cells are accessible as they) come from embryos/bone marrow/umbilical cord blood/adult
                   tissue;
                   c. (stem cells) can regenerate/repair diseased/damaged tissues in people;                                                  3 max
                   d. valid specific example;
                   e. drugs can be tested on stem cells (in laboratories to see if they are harmful);

6.     b           a. leaf cells contain chloroplasts;
                   b. light is absorbed by chlorophyll (in chloroplasts);
                   c. other pigments absorb different wavelengths;
                   d. light energy is used in photosynthesis;
                   e. (light is needed) to combine water and carbon dioxide/fix carbon dioxide;
                                                                                                                                              5 max
                   f. carbon compounds/organic compounds/glucose/starch/carbohydrate are produced;
                   g. blue and red light is absorbed;                                                                     Wavelengths
                   h. perform photolysis                                                                                  accepted for mpg
                   OR
                   split water molecules;
                                                                                                                                          (continued…)
                                                                           – 10 –                                      M22/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

(Question 6 continued)

      Question                                                Answers                                                     Notes                   Total
 6.     c        Platelets: [3 max]
                 a. damage/cuts to blood vessels causes platelets to be activated;
                 b. the platelets release clotting factors;
                 c. initiates cascade of reactions
                 OR
                    fibrinogen is converted to fibrin;
                 d. forms a mesh over the damaged area;
                 e. prevents pathogens from entering the body;

                 Phagocytes: [3 max]
                 f. phagocytes/phagocytic white blood cells in the blood travel to the site of infection;   ECF may be applied when
                 g. (phagocytes) squeeze between the capillary cells;                                       candidates use white blood cells in   7 max
                                                                                                            place of specific terms
                 h. (phagocytes) engulf/ingest/take in pathogens;
                 i. the pathogen is digested/broken down by/within the phagocyte;


                 Lymphocytes: [3 max]
                 j. lymphocytes recognize a particular fragment/antigen of a pathogen;
                 k. (lymphocytes) release antibodies;
                 l. (antibodies) provide specific immunity;
                 m. memory cells provide rapid response giving long-term immunity (to pathogens
                    previously recognised);
                 n. antibodies destroy pathogens;
                                                                             – 11 –                                             M22/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

     Question                                    Answers                                                                   Notes                          Total
7.     a        a. ribose drawn as a pentagon and labelled;                                          Award [2 max] if more than one nucleotide
                b. base linked correctly (to C1) of ribose and labelled;                             drawn.
                c. phosphate linked correctly (to C5) of ribose and labelled;                        “Sugar” alone is insufficient.




                                                                                                                                                            3




7.     b                                                                                                                                Distinguish
                                             Mitosis                                                   Meiosis
                  a.    occurs in/produces somatic cells                       occurs in/produces sex cells;
                  b.    one cell division                                      two cell divisions;
                  c.    produces two (daughter) cells                          produces four (daughter) cells;
                  d     daughter cells identical to parent cell / does not     daughter cells differ from parent cell / produces
                        produce genetic variation                              genetic variation;                                                         5 max
                  e     produces cells for growth/repair                       produces gametes/for reproduction;
                  f     chromosome number stays the same/2n/diploid            chromosome number is halved/1n/haploid;

                  g     pairing of chromosomes does not occur                  homologous chromosomes join together/pair;
                  h     no exchange of material between                        exchange of material between
                        chromosomes/no crossing over;                          chromosomes/crossing over;


                                                                                                                                                      (continued…)
                                                                            – 12 –                                   M22/4/BIOLO/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

(Question 7 continued)

     Question                                              Answers                                                       Notes                  Total
7.     c         a. antibiotics can (generally) kill/destroy bacteria;                                     Award 6 Max if pathogen is used
                 b. some bacteria show variation/antibiotic resistance;                                    instead of bacteria throughout the
                                                                                                           answer with no mention of
                 c. variation/resistance is due to a random mutation;                                      bacteria.
                 d. resistant bacteria are not killed/destroyed by the antibiotic
                    OR
                    bacteria without the mutation die;
                                                                                                                                                7 max
                 e. (resistant) bacteria have a selective advantage / unequal success;
                 f. the bacteria with this variation/resistance reproduces/multiplies;
                 g. mutation/gene is passed on to the offspring / the offspring will be resistant to the
                    antibiotic;
                 h. resistant bacteria become more common;
                 i. bacteria have evolved to be resistant to the antibiotic;
